name: Rulers
author: RiceKirby
summary: A theme that revolves around government systems (Democracy, Anarchy, Monarchy and Tyranny). Find the Mafia while the rules that decide who gets the power constantly change! *** [Democracy: Most voted player becomes President, who can give extra powers to other players] [Anarchy: Any player can use any action (only 1 per turn), but with a chance of failing] [Monarchy: A daykiller King is chosen among the villagers whenever the current King dies] [Tyranny: All players can fight to become a Tyrant (gets 1000 votes); when a Tyrant is alive, players can try to steal their position and become the Tyrant themselves]

sides.winmsg: Oh my, ~Players~, the Historian has won this alone? How could you guys fail that much?

variables.KingHelpMsg: As the King, you can use /kill [name] during the standby to kill someone else without getting revealed. Be aware that you cannot be protected!
variables.RulerIgnoreDistractMsg: It seems someone is not aware you are the President and tried, without any success, to distract you from your duties.
variables.ResetRulersConvertMsg: ~Target~ (President and their Ministers) have stepped down from the power in a very democratic way!
variables.ResetRulersLynchMsg: ~Self~ will be the new President from now on!
variables.HealthConvertMsg: ~Target~ has joined the Ministry of Health by the President's nomination and is now able to protect others at night!
variables.EducationConvertMsg: ~Target~ has joined the Ministry of Education by the President's nomination and is now able to expose someone's side during the day!
variables.JusticeConvertMsg: ~Target~ has joined the Ministry of Justice by the President's nomination and is now able to kill another player during the day!
variables.GreetTargetMsg: ~Self~. the ~Role~, has revealed their identity to you!
variables.ResetTyrantsMsg: The Tyrant is dead! Will a new Tyrant rise to the power?
variables.ExposeReadyMsg: You can use /expose [name] to reveal someone's side!
variables.ExposeMsg: A recent study has revealed that ~Target~ is sided with ~Side~!
variables.DaykillReadyMsg: You can use /kill [name] to kill another player!
variables.NextKingMsg: A successor to the throne with Royal Blood was found! A new King is born!
variables.KingDaykillReadyMsg: You can use /kill [name] to kill another player (you won't be revealed)!

HealthConvert.usermsg: You nominated ~Target~ to the Ministry of Health!

JusticeConvert.usermsg: You nominated ~Target~ to the Ministry of Justice!

roles.startupmsg: Â±Game: You are the ~Role~! [Current mode: Democracy]
roles.help: As someone who studies the political history, you have been given the duty of keeping the government systems under control, allowing you to use /anarchy, /monarchy or /tyranny during the day to change the current system. You are immune to night and daykills!
roles.help2: During Democracy, you win with Good People or Werewolf!

anarchy.revealmsg: The government system has changed to Anarchy!

monarchy.revealmsg: The government system has changed to Monarchy!

tyranny.revealmsg: The government system has changed to Tyranny!

roles.startupmsg: Â±Game: You are the ~Role~! [Current mode: Anarchy]
roles.help: As someone who studies the political history, you have been given the duty of keeping the government systems under control, allowing you to use /democracy, /monarchy or /tyranny during the day to change the current system. During Anarchy, you can evade up to 2 nightkills!
roles.help2: During Anarchy, you win with everyone!

democracy.revealmsg: The government system has changed to Democracy!

monarchy.revealmsg: The government system has changed to Monarchy!

tyranny.revealmsg: The government system has changed to Tyranny!

roles.info: Can change the current game mode to Democracy, Anarchy, Monarchy or Tyranny every 3 days. Cannot be distracted. Evades night and daykills (during Anarchy, only evades nightkills twice). Wins with different sides according to the mode: Anarchy (everyone), Monarchy (Mafia and Werewolf), Democracy (Good People and Werewolf) or Tyranny (Good People and Mafia).

roles.startupmsg: Â±Game: You are a ~Role~! [Current mode: Democracy]
roles.help: Vote during the day to elect a new President. Being a member of the Ministry of Education, you can also use /expose during the day to reveal someone's side.

changelog.17.06.2015: Historian now change systems during the day. Democracy largely changed: President now picks 3 Ministers (a daykiller, an exposer and a bodyguard) but they lose their powers once the president is changed. President now can be re-elected.
changelog.28.07.2014: Mafia Boss no longer inspects as Villager.
changelog.18.06.2014: President can now nominate 3 Ministers per night (can use all commands).
changelog.11.06.2014: Historian can vote normally. Historian now wins with only 2 sides (according to current system). Historian is not immune to poison and lynch anymore. Werewolf now has a better chance of becoming Tyrant. Players are now told which powers they can receive if they become Ministers.
changelog.28.05.2014: Theme's name changed to Rulers. Game now begins in a random government system. Historian is now unable to vote. President evades 1 nightkill. Chances for /tyrant and /coup increased.
changelog.17.03.2014: Each government system now lasts at least 3 turns. Tweaked Priority for /tyrant and /coup and increased the chances of both working.
changelog.16.03.2014: Increased priority for President's power assignment. Historian's vote now counts as 0. Fixed error where President could find someone's role when giving them powers.
changelog.12.03.2014: Fixed role description for everyone during Anarchy to make it clear they can't use all of their actions at the same night. President is now immune to distraction.
changelog.11.03.2014: Some of the Villagers are now unable to become King during Monarchy. Fixed /protect not usable on teammates. Broadcast messages fixed. Removed message that revealed which role had became the Tyrant.

tips.Historian: Be careful with the system you choose. Each system benefits a different side, so the other sides may turn against you, while the buffed one may try to kill you so the system is not changed anymore.
tips.Democracy: When you become the President, 3 targets will be automatically picked for the Ministry commands, but you can change them to fit your tastes. Also, pay attention to who was nominated by the President in case the President was sided with Mafia or Werewolf.
tips.Anarchy: Be careful when using poison and kill actions if you are sided with village, as you may end damaging your side too much if you get the wrong person.
tips.Monarchy: King cannot be protected, so village will need to find another player to connect the PRs. If you are mafia, try to take advantage of that.
tips.Tyranny: If you become the Tyrant, keep saying you are trying to use /coup so other players won't suspect and /coup you.
